info.txt (which is simply these notes included in the torrent)

Biography from All Music (by Bruce Eder):

This quintet started out in the late '50s (curiously, by way of Canada) and by the mid-'60s were a popular folk ensemble on television on two continents. Although their work, exuberant and boisterous, with relatively little scholarship, and lacking a traditional sound, became less fashionable with the ascent of groups like the Chieftains, the Irish Rovers continue to have a devoted core following.

Taken from: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-irish-rovers-p806/biography" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-irish-rovers-p806/biography</a>

All Music Album Review (by Bruce Eder):

The single most popular record that The Irish Rovers ever made, their cover of Shel Silverstein's slyly written "The Unicorn" stands apart from the more straightforward material on this album, which is devoted to good times, family, and religious differences, and other significant elements of Irish song.

Taken from: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/album/r103052" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/album/r103052</a>
